Article.Title: Seattle Aquarium’s newest harbor seal meets his daddy
Article.Summary: The Seattle Aquarium introduced its newest resident, a harbor seal named Hogan, on Tuesday.

Article.Title: Teen shot in head in Tukwila Tuesday night
Article.Summary: Medics took the man to Harborview Medical Center in critical condition.

Article.Title: The Donald’s defenders mostly MIA
Article.Summary: The Donald Trump campaign is big and brash, but is there any there there? It doesn’t feel like a campaign in which anyone will go to the mat for him, let alone door to door.

Article.Title: Building a replica of native history
Article.Summary: You never know what you’ll find looking through a closet. Especially when it’s holding parts of a 16 million-item collection. Sven Haakanson Jr., curator of North American Anthropology at the Burke Museum, found a model of an Angyaaq, a traditional Native boat made by Alaska’s Sugpiat people, misidentified in its vast collection. He had an […]

Article.Title: Anti-Islamic rhetoric shakes Snoqualmie’s Muslim families
Article.Summary: Donald Trump’s plan to ban Muslims from entering the United States alarmed local Muslims in Snoqualmie who were already on the defensive after their state Rep. Jay Rodne said Islam was incompatible with Western civilization and called Muslims “barbarians.”

Article.Title: Microkitchens for millennials ‘in a very urban, Seattle way’
Article.Summary: In cities like Seattle, the aspirational kitchens of young cooks have small footprints and shrunken appliances.

Article.Title: Mercer Island rejects moratorium on dividing lots
Article.Summary: Council members questioned whether the measure was the right tool to address growing complaints that some new-home construction is out of scale and character with existing properties.

Article.Title: Feds accuse Washington man of possessing illegal rifle
Article.Summary: FBI agents investigating domestic terrorism and threats against the government have arrested a Washington man for possessing an illegal rifle

Article.Title: I-405 express tolls higher than expected, near $10
Article.Summary: Tolls approaching the $10 limit were forecast to be rare occasions for the new Interstate 405 Express Toll Lanes, but this week, they‘re the new normal.

Article.Title: Craigslist marijuana theft led to SeaTac homicide, prosecutors say
Article.Summary: Aaron Parypa, 39, was charged Tuesday with second-degree murder and first-degree assault, accused of firing an assault rifle at two men who had stolen marijuana from him. One man was killed in the Oct. 29 shooting and the second bailed out of his car to avoid getting shot.
